to a desktop computer.

96
00:04:50.980 --> 00:04:56.630
Now, when a potential millennial
walks into your company and

97
00:04:56.630 --> 00:05:00.665
see's that every single person in that
company is on a desktop computer,

98
00:05:00.665 --> 00:05:02.740
you're indirectly sending
a message saying,

99
00:05:02.740 --> 00:05:05.490
we don't allow you to work
from outside the office.

100
00:05:05.490 --> 00:05:09.188
You need to work from here,
everybody works from here.

101
00:05:09.188 --> 00:05:11.798
Now, when they walk in and
they see half your team, or

102
00:05:11.798 --> 00:05:15.974
maybe all of your team working on laptops,
you're sending out a different message,

103
00:05:15.974 --> 00:05:18.700
and you're saying we're
embracing technology.

104
00:05:18.700 --> 00:05:22.070
We understand that certain
life situations may happen.

105
00:05:22.070 --> 00:05:24.320
And it may be more convenient for
you to be mobile.

106
00:05:24.320 --> 00:05:26.830
Maybe you're a salesperson, and
you're gonna be out on the road.

107
00:05:26.830 --> 00:05:28.810
And we want you to have
access to technology.

108
00:05:28.810 --> 00:05:33.340
We want you to be able to use the power
of technology to get better, or

109
00:05:33.340 --> 00:05:33.910
more efficient.

110
00:05:33.910 --> 00:05:35.220
I mean, so many companies nowadays,

111
00:05:35.220 --> 00:05:39.620
it blows my mind how any
organization that has a sales team,

112
00:05:39.620 --> 00:05:42.344
I don't care if it's one person,
I don't care if it's a thousand people.

113
00:05:42.344 --> 00:05:45.437
If you have a sales team, if you
have a sales person in your company,

114
00:05:45.437 --> 00:05:48.050
which I'm assuming everybody does.

115
00:05:48.050 --> 00:05:50.640
How does your company
operate without a CRM?

116
00:05:51.760 --> 00:05:55.630
You need to have a CRM in place for
your organization.

117
00:05:55.630 --> 00:06:00.495
If you expect your sales team to run
off Excel, that is completely outdated.

118
00:06:00.495 --> 00:06:03.830
It's ineffective, and
it will no way scale your business.

119
00:06:03.830 --> 00:06:07.790
You need to start embracing technology,
and use the power of technology, so

120
00:06:07.790 --> 00:06:11.110
that your team can be extremely powerful.

121
00:06:11.110 --> 00:06:13.740
Millennials come in,
salesperson or non-salesperson,

122
00:06:13.740 --> 00:06:14.610
they come into your company.

123
00:06:14.610 --> 00:06:17.130
The first thing they should be
asking is do you have a CRM?

124
00:06:17.130 --> 00:06:18.670
What CRM do you use?

125
00:06:18.670 --> 00:06:20.210
Because that is so powerful.

126
00:06:20.210 --> 00:06:24.220
Without that, there's so much manual
labor that needs to happen, that is so

127
00:06:24.220 --> 00:06:26.560
redundant and so ineffective.

128
00:06:26.560 --> 00:06:29.530
And that will completely create
a disconnect with the millennial, or

129
00:06:29.530 --> 00:06:32.620
with any other person that has
experience working with a CRM.

130
00:06:32.620 --> 00:06:33.740
They know, you need that.

131
00:06:33.740 --> 00:06:37.110
But you have to be able to embrace
these new technologies because,

132
00:06:37.110 --> 00:06:41.260
a millennial again,
will reject these ideas, and

133
00:06:41.260 --> 00:06:44.920
completely disconnect, and
say I'm going somewhere else.

134
00:06:44.920 --> 00:06:49.270
Again, unlike previous generations, that
say, well okay, I'll tolerate your Excel,

135
00:06:49.270 --> 00:06:52.205
maybe I'll convince you down
the line to get a CRM, right?

136
00:06:52.205 --> 00:06:55.000
Millennials will say,
you don't have that, I quit.

137
00:06:55.000 --> 00:06:56.490
Or, I'm not even gonna work for you.

138
00:06:56.490 --> 00:06:57.520
>> Yeah, that tells them that,

139
00:06:57.520 --> 00:06:59.620
maybe you're a little bit behind
the times in your company.

140
00:06:59.620 --> 00:07:02.400
>> It's an indirect signal to them,
that tells them about your culture, and

141
00:07:02.400 --> 00:07:04.270
the direction in which
your company is going.

142
00:07:04.270 --> 00:07:06.515
And you cannot take these tools
away from the millennials.

143
00:07:06.515 --> 00:07:12.130
Because, while previous generations
used the cell phone to make phone calls,

144
00:07:12.130 --> 00:07:16.980
this generation uses it for
text messages, like it's natural.

145
00:07:16.980 --> 00:07:19.050
This generation will be
texting your customers.

146
00:07:20.140 --> 00:07:21.590
Now all the HR people flip out about that.

147
00:07:21.590 --> 00:07:23.330
Like, my gosh, what are we doing?

148
00:07:23.330 --> 00:07:24.950
>> And the security people flip out too,

149
00:07:24.950 --> 00:07:27.170
with the whole bring your own
device to work kind of crowd.

150
00:07:27.170 --> 00:07:28.597
>> Yeah,
everybody starts flipping out, right?

151
00:07:28.597 --> 00:07:30.417
So I mean, but
there's ways around that, right?

152
00:07:30.417 --> 00:07:33.060
You just gotta get creative and
understand how you can control that.

153
00:07:33.060 --> 00:07:36.260
But understand that they want
to communicate via text.

154
00:07:36.260 --> 00:07:40.150
Probably most of the businesses that are
gonna be working with your company have

155
00:07:40.150 --> 00:07:46.270
millennials, or the clients you're
selling to are millennials.

156
00:07:46.270 --> 00:07:49.130
I mean, it's just natural, it's gonna
happen because they're coming of age, and

157
00:07:49.130 --> 00:07:50.300
they're coming into the work place,

158
00:07:50.300 --> 00:07:52.760
it's natural that you're gonna
be selling to millennials.

159
00:07:52.760 --> 00:07:55.170
How do those millennials
want to communicate?

160
00:07:55.170 --> 00:07:57.030
They wanna communicate
through text message.

161
00:07:57.030 --> 00:07:58.140
You start forcing them,

162
00:07:58.140 --> 00:08:03.940
I know we think that email is the modern
way, email is not that modern anymore.

163
00:08:03.940 --> 00:08:05.650
Email is one of those things,

164
00:08:05.650 --> 00:08:08.810
almost like, email to millennial
is like a fax is to a Gen X.

165
00:08:10.210 --> 00:08:13.170
Right, it's okay it was the modern thing.

166
00:08:13.170 --> 00:08:15.600
Everybody has one,
we do it because it's natural.

167
00:08:15.600 --> 00:08:17.630
But understand that millenials now,

168
00:08:17.630 --> 00:08:19.650
I want to text you because
I want an instant answer.

169
00:08:19.650 --> 00:08:20.400
Now, now, now.
>> And

170
00:08:20.400 --> 00:08:22.690
we keep talking about
Amazon as a great example.

171
00:08:22.690 --> 00:08:26.574
I mean if you go to their support page and
you have a problem with an order,

172
00:08:26.574 --> 00:08:28.166
you can call, you can email,

173
00:08:28.166 --> 00:08:31.692
or you can chat right there, and
it almost tells you it's by age.

174
00:08:31.692 --> 00:08:35.429
You've got Baby Boomer, you've got Gen X,
and now you've got millennials in there,

175
00:08:35.429 --> 00:08:37.853
because that's the way to
just get that instant answer,

176
00:08:37.853 --> 00:08:40.590
you can still be multitasking,
do something else.

177
00:08:40.590 --> 00:08:45.180
>> Yeah, so this technology you have
in your organization, or lack thereof,

178
00:08:45.180 --> 00:08:46.730
is extremely critical.

179
00:08:46.730 --> 00:08:51.120
And again, remember that this is how this
generation communicates with their family,

180
00:08:51.120 --> 00:08:51.970
with their friends.

181
00:08:51.970 --> 00:08:56.130
I mean, Gen Xers defined communication,
or staying in touch with friends right,

182
00:08:56.130 --> 00:09:02.230
as a phone call where you'd have a voice
conversation once every so often.

183
00:09:02.230 --> 00:09:07.490
Milennials, if we're friends on Facebook,
we're connected, right, that's it.

184
00:09:07.490 --> 00:09:09.180
We're connected, and we're okay with it.

185
00:09:09.180 --> 00:09:11.360
And our receiving friend
millennial understands it.

186
00:09:11.360 --> 00:09:12.440
That's how we're connected.

187
00:09:12.440 --> 00:09:13.790
We don't need to to pick up the phone and

188
00:09:13.790 --> 00:09:16.780
actually have a physical conversation
to maintain the relationship.

189
00:09:16.780 --> 00:09:21.190
Which I know is hard to understand,
but just understand that it's true.

190
00:09:21.190 --> 00:09:23.060
Understand that that's how they reason.

191
00:09:23.060 --> 00:09:25.520
So the moment you take away technology,
and

192
00:09:25.520 --> 00:09:30.640
you take away access to Facebook, or
you take away access to the social media,

193
00:09:30.640 --> 00:09:32.340
you're literally shooting
yourself in the foot.

194
00:09:32.340 --> 00:09:36.320
Because these millennials will be tweeting
about your company culture, will be

195
00:09:36.320 --> 00:09:40.460
Instagramming pictures, live videos about
all the cool things your company is doing

196
00:09:40.460 --> 00:09:41.410
>> Or go on Glassdoor and

197
00:09:41.410 --> 00:09:44.400
tell you about the bad things you're
doing, if you do have some of those things

198
00:09:44.400 --> 00:09:46.830
in place I'm sure there's
exceptions to the rules.

199
00:09:46.830 --> 00:09:48.810
Like here we have some editing stations.

200
00:09:48.810 --> 00:09:52.070
Those have to be these big machines
that are tied to your desk.

201
00:09:52.070 --> 00:09:53.650
Or if you're working at the NSA,

202
00:09:53.650 --> 00:09:56.795
you're probably not bringing your
phone into work, or not allowed to.

203
00:09:56.795 --> 00:09:57.950
>> [LAUGH]
>> But n most cases,

204
00:09:57.950 --> 00:10:03.650
it sounds like giving them some of those
personal freedoms, are maybe going to just

205
00:10:03.650 --> 00:10:09.210
make them a lot happier at work, and
help them to enjoy the culture more.

206
00:10:09.210 --> 00:10:10.000
>> Yeah, definitely.
And, again,

207
00:10:10.000 --> 00:10:12.270
remember they're dependent
on this technology, right?

208
00:10:12.270 --> 00:10:13.610
They live their lives out there.

209
00:10:13.610 --> 00:10:15.380
So if they live their
lives on this technology,

210
00:10:15.380 --> 00:10:17.880
it's almost like a habit
that they naturally have.

211
00:10:17.880 --> 00:10:21.190
And if we're understanding the concept of
their personal life and their work life as

212
00:10:21.190 --> 00:10:26.030
one thing, then when they come into work,
you're creating a disconnect again.

213
00:10:26.030 --> 00:10:30.000
You're creating that space,
that tension, which makes them unhappy,

214
00:10:30.000 --> 00:10:34.080
which will lead to unhappy employees,
which will lead to them quitting.

215
00:10:34.080 --> 00:10:35.690
And you're not gonna
create that culture and

216
00:10:35.690 --> 00:10:37.440
that environment that you wanna create.

217
00:10:37.440 --> 00:10:38.130
>> Fantastic, Javier.

218
00:10:38.130 --> 00:10:41.440
It looks like we're getting close to
the end of the time for this episode.

219
00:10:41.440 --> 00:10:42.940
Any final thoughts, here?

220
00:10:42.940 --> 00:10:45.932
>> No, I just want to be clear that
millennials are not necessarily

221
00:10:45.932 --> 00:10:46.840
tech savvy.

222
00:10:46.840 --> 00:10:49.580
So bringing on a millennial and
expecting them to know how to work

223
00:10:49.580 --> 00:10:53.260
all of your electronics,
it's not something that's an expectation.

224
00:10:53.260 --> 00:10:56.480
They still need to be trained on
things and how to use certain things.

225
00:10:56.480 --> 00:10:57.635
Just because they're younger,

226
00:10:57.635 --> 00:10:59.911
doesn't mean that they know how
to operate all the electronics.

227
00:10:59.911 --> 00:11:02.136
The key word here is
they're tech dependent, so

228
00:11:02.136 --> 00:11:03.718
they will depend on these things.

229
00:11:03.718 --> 00:11:05.354
They run their lives on here, and

230
00:11:05.354 --> 00:11:09.170
they need this technology to be able
to run your organizations as well.

231
00:11:09.170 --> 00:11:09.870
>> Great.

232
00:11:09.870 --> 00:11:10.780
Great information there.

233
00:11:10.780 --> 00:11:13.310
I know we've got a lot more great
information to cover in some

234
00:11:13.310 --> 00:11:14.540
subsequent episodes.

235
00:11:14.540 --> 00:11:16.980
If you haven't seen the previous ones,
go back and watch those and

236
00:11:16.980 --> 00:11:19.750
learn a lot about what we've
talked about already with

237
00:11:19.750 --> 00:11:21.270
understanding millennials
in the workplace.

238
00:11:21.270 --> 00:11:23.970
But for now, signing off,
I'm Peter Van Rysdam.

239
00:11:23.970 --> 00:11:25.890
>> And I'm Javier Montes,
your millennial expert.

240
00:11:25.890 --> 00:11:27.322
We'll see you next time.

241
00:11:27.322 --> 00:11:36.571
[MUSIC]

episodes.title: Give My Work Meaning and Value
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:03.595
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:03.595 --> 00:00:06.000
Hello and welcome to the show.

3
00:00:06.000 --> 00:00:07.370
I'm your host, Peter VanRysdam.

4
00:00:07.370 --> 00:00:12.240
And today, we are continuing in our series
about millennials in the workforce.

5
00:00:12.240 --> 00:00:14.460
And here to help us,
we have an expert on the topic.

6
00:00:14.460 --> 00:00:17.890
So much so, he wrote the book
Millennial Workforce, Javier Montes.

7
00:00:17.890 --> 00:00:18.830
Javier, how are you're doing?

8
00:00:18.830 --> 00:00:20.180
>> I'm doing fantastic, Peter.

9
00:00:20.180 --> 00:00:20.990
Thank you for having me.

10
00:00:20.990 --> 00:00:22.850
It's a pleasure to be here once again.

11
00:00:22.850 --> 00:00:28.030
And I'm so excited to keep talking with
you about millennials in the workforce.

12
00:00:28.030 --> 00:00:32.396
>> And I understand in this episode we're
talking about more now what millennials

13
00:00:32.396 --> 00:00:34.294
are looking for in the workplace.

14
00:00:34.294 --> 00:00:37.410
And what are we specifically
talking about in this episode?

15
00:00:37.410 --> 00:00:41.185
>> So, today, we're gonna talk all about
the first general topic is what do

16
00:00:41.185 --> 00:00:43.700
millennials want in the workforce,
in the workplace?

17
00:00:43.700 --> 00:00:48.514
And the first thing millennials want
in the workplace is they want our

18
00:00:48.514 --> 00:00:51.924
companies to give their work meaning and
value.

19
00:00:51.924 --> 00:00:53.480
Now what does that mean exactly?

20
00:00:53.480 --> 00:00:57.130
What does give my work meaning and
value mean to a millennial?

21
00:00:57.130 --> 00:01:01.348
And what does it mean to somebody that's
running the organization, an entrepreneur,

22
00:01:01.348 --> 00:01:02.887
a business manager, a leader?

23
00:01:02.887 --> 00:01:05.370
What does that mean exactly?

24
00:01:05.370 --> 00:01:10.240
Well, let's start by understanding
that millennials are extremely clear

25
00:01:10.240 --> 00:01:13.290
on what their personal purpose in life is.

26
00:01:13.290 --> 00:01:16.920
So millennials have a very clear
sense of what their passion is and

27
00:01:16.920 --> 00:01:18.580
what their purpose is.

28
00:01:18.580 --> 00:01:21.055
And as a millennial, they are looking for

29
00:01:21.055 --> 00:01:25.110
organizations that can
align with their purpose.

30
00:01:25.110 --> 00:01:28.185
So what I've seen in the past and
what I still see today.

31
00:01:28.185 --> 00:01:30.872
I think a lot of entrepreneurs
come to me and ask me, Javier,

32
00:01:30.872 --> 00:01:32.520
how can I attract more millennials?

33
00:01:32.520 --> 00:01:34.411
I can't retain them,
they don't stay with my company.

34
00:01:34.411 --> 00:01:39.007
So what is it that I can do
to bring more millennials?

35
00:01:39.007 --> 00:01:41.670
Because I wanna bring this
generation into my company.

36
00:01:41.670 --> 00:01:44.730
And the first thing that I ask them is,
what is your company's purpose?

37
00:01:45.850 --> 00:01:49.995
And most of the time, Peter, what people
tell me and the answers that they give me.

38
00:01:49.995 --> 00:01:57.745
Is most Gen Xers will tell me
something like well, they don't know.

39
00:01:57.745 --> 00:01:58.963
>> [LAUGH]
>> So I say, okay,

40
00:01:58.963 --> 00:02:00.890
well why did you start your business?

41
00:02:00.890 --> 00:02:03.050
Why did you start your
business in the first place?

42
00:02:03.050 --> 00:02:05.570
And the first answer that I get is, well,

43
00:02:05.570 --> 00:02:10.450
to make some money, and
I laugh and I say, my gosh.

44
00:02:10.450 --> 00:02:12.460
That couldn't be farther from the truth.

45
00:02:12.460 --> 00:02:15.353
Because if that was true you
could have started any business.

46
00:02:15.353 --> 00:02:19.207
But you chose to start this particular
business because of something else.

47
00:02:19.207 --> 00:02:22.277
There's a deeper meaning, there's
a deeper purpose and a deeper passion.

48
00:02:22.277 --> 00:02:26.030
That every entrepreneur has for
choosing the business that they started.

49
00:02:26.030 --> 00:02:27.390
And it's not to chase money.

50
00:02:27.390 --> 00:02:28.682
Money is a byproduct.

51
00:02:28.682 --> 00:02:32.780
Money is a tool that allows
us to live our lives, but

52
00:02:32.780 --> 00:02:35.800
it's not the reason why we
really started the business.

53
00:02:35.800 --> 00:02:38.148
There's a purpose and
a reason why we started the business.

54
00:02:38.148 --> 00:02:41.379
And typically it's to change
something that exists in the world.

55
00:02:41.379 --> 00:02:44.666
Or to provide a service that
will make something easier for

56
00:02:44.666 --> 00:02:46.149
your customers, right.

57
00:02:46.149 --> 00:02:47.676
There is a reason why you started it.

58
00:02:47.676 --> 00:02:51.197
And when I sit there and I ask,
95% of the entrepreneurs and

59
00:02:51.197 --> 00:02:53.647
business owners that I ask this question.

60
00:02:53.647 --> 00:02:55.170
Their answer is, I don't know.

61
00:02:55.170 --> 00:02:56.700
So that's the first problem.

62
00:02:56.700 --> 00:03:00.830
The first problem is our businesses
don't know what our purpose is.

63
00:03:00.830 --> 00:03:03.170
And for those of us that do,
comes a second problem.

64
00:03:03.170 --> 00:03:05.830
And the second problem
is that the businesses

65
00:03:05.830 --> 00:03:08.400
don't clearly communicate
that purpose to the world.

66
00:03:09.400 --> 00:03:11.000
And that's where the disconnect comes in.

67
00:03:11.000 --> 00:03:14.033
You see, millennials are looking to
align their personal purpose with our

68
00:03:14.033 --> 00:03:15.198
organization's purpose.

69
00:03:15.198 --> 00:03:17.030
And if they can't find that purpose or

70
00:03:17.030 --> 00:03:19.847
they don't understand what
your company's purpose is.

71
00:03:19.847 --> 00:03:23.525
There's a disconnect and
they don't have any meaning or value.

72
00:03:23.525 --> 00:03:26.775
Their purpose is not aligned because
they can't align with anything.

73
00:03:26.775 --> 00:03:28.557
So as organizational leaders,

74
00:03:28.557 --> 00:03:31.729
what we need to do first of all
is really clearly sit down.

75
00:03:31.729 --> 00:03:36.064
Take some time either by ourselves or
with our leadership team and write down,

76
00:03:36.064 --> 00:03:37.795
why is it that we exist?

77
00:03:37.795 --> 00:03:39.875
What is the purpose of our organization?

78
00:03:39.875 --> 00:03:41.261
What do we wanna change in the world?

79
00:03:41.261 --> 00:03:44.624
One of my mentors asked me a while back,
he said,

80
00:03:44.624 --> 00:03:47.834
what is it that exists
currently in the world.

81
00:03:47.834 --> 00:03:52.540
That really upsets you that you
don't think should be the way it is?

82
00:03:52.540 --> 00:03:53.780
That's a great question.

83
00:03:53.780 --> 00:03:55.290
That's a great question and chances are,

84
00:03:55.290 --> 00:03:58.870
that leads you to start a business that
will fix that problem in the world.

85
00:03:58.870 --> 00:04:01.170
I mean, for me, I'll be honest,

86
00:04:01.170 --> 00:04:05.590
it was I built my company with
an exclusive millennial workforce.

87
00:04:05.590 --> 00:04:07.780
Not purposefully it just
kind of happened that way.

88
00:04:07.780 --> 00:04:09.670
And I decided to write this book.

89
00:04:09.670 --> 00:04:11.325
I decided to pursue professional speaking.

90
00:04:11.325 --> 00:04:15.552
Because I was so
upset about the way that people described

91
00:04:15.552 --> 00:04:20.480
millennials that didn't
accurately describe my team.

92
00:04:20.480 --> 00:04:22.010
My team has been with my long term.

93
00:04:22.010 --> 00:04:24.460
They're not lazy,
they're hard working individuals.

94
00:04:24.460 --> 00:04:25.629
They're very proud of what they do.

95
00:04:25.629 --> 00:04:28.876
And most of their days,
most of their weeks,

96
00:04:28.876 --> 00:04:32.560
are dedicated to our business and
our company.

97
00:04:32.560 --> 00:04:34.340
And I said,
how can you say that they're entitled?

98
00:04:34.340 --> 00:04:36.130
How can you say that they're lazy?

99
00:04:36.130 --> 00:04:37.771
Maybe your millennials have been lazy.

100
00:04:37.771 --> 00:04:40.215
Or maybe,
like we've talked about in other videos.

101
00:04:40.215 --> 00:04:42.644
Maybe we need to take a look
in the mirror and say, whoa,

102
00:04:42.644 --> 00:04:44.920
what are we doing as an organization?

103
00:04:44.920 --> 00:04:46.600
Are we causing this?

104
00:04:46.600 --> 00:04:50.298
Are we causing millennials to come
on board to our companies and

105
00:04:50.298 --> 00:04:51.356
maybe seem lazy.

106
00:04:51.356 --> 00:04:53.341
Or maybe they're just unengaged.

107
00:04:53.341 --> 00:04:54.974
And 95% of the time,

108
00:04:54.974 --> 00:05:00.680
I can tie this back to the company not
clearly communicating its purpose.

109
00:05:00.680 --> 00:05:01.840
Now, how do we communicate our purpose?

110
00:05:01.840 --> 00:05:03.370
What action can we take on this?

111
00:05:03.370 --> 00:05:05.383
We talked about number one,
establishing what that purpose is.

112
00:05:05.383 --> 00:05:09.244
Number two, the second most important
part about communicating your purpose.

113
00:05:09.244 --> 00:05:11.841
Is you need to be very clear and blunt and

114
00:05:11.841 --> 00:05:15.560
tell the entire world what
your company's purpose is.

115
00:05:15.560 --> 00:05:16.980
How do you do that?

116
00:05:16.980 --> 00:05:19.520
Your company's purpose needs to be
listed clearly on your website.

117
00:05:19.520 --> 00:05:23.172
I would say the first thing on top of your
website, right next to your company name,

118
00:05:23.172 --> 00:05:24.280
right next to your logo.

119
00:05:24.280 --> 00:05:27.030
Should be the reason why
your company exists.

120
00:05:27.030 --> 00:05:29.960
Number two, it should be in
every e-mail signature that

121
00:05:29.960 --> 00:05:32.180
you have that goes out from
all of your employees.

122
00:05:32.180 --> 00:05:34.500
Number three,
it should be on your business cards.

123
00:05:34.500 --> 00:05:38.590
It should be on every single piece of
collateral material that you create,

124
00:05:38.590 --> 00:05:41.115
your purpose needs to be
clearly stated there.

125
00:05:41.115 --> 00:05:44.130
Millennials do not take subtle hints,
all right?

126
00:05:44.130 --> 00:05:45.170
That's the truth.

127
00:05:45.170 --> 00:05:47.830
You can't expect them to
guess what your purpose is.

128
00:05:47.830 --> 00:05:50.710
Right now, if you don't have
your purpose clearly stated,

129
00:05:50.710 --> 00:05:54.690
your employees are guessing
the reason why your company exists.

130
00:05:54.690 --> 00:05:57.260
Millennials and non-millennials,
they don't know what it is.

131
00:05:57.260 --> 00:06:01.810
See, a lot of us have this idea of
a vision statement or a mission statement.

132
00:06:01.810 --> 00:06:06.335
And these are terms or phrases that
were created by previous generations.

133
00:06:06.335 --> 00:06:08.898
Typically, in big corporate America,
they sit in some plaque or

134
00:06:08.898 --> 00:06:11.471
in a frame in the CEO's office,
maybe the COO's office as well.

135
00:06:11.471 --> 00:06:12.825
And nobody ever reads it.

136
00:06:12.825 --> 00:06:16.295
You ask the employees of that company what
is our mission statement, why do we exist?

137
00:06:16.295 --> 00:06:19.225
And they'll rant off two or three words
that they may have heard one time.

138
00:06:19.225 --> 00:06:21.275
Most of them are gonna say,
I have no idea what it is.

139
00:06:21.275 --> 00:06:24.845
I have no idea why we exist,
I have no idea what our mission is.

140
00:06:24.845 --> 00:06:27.865
Why does our company continue to work so
hard?

141
00:06:27.865 --> 00:06:28.995
What are we trying to change in the world?

142
00:06:28.995 --> 00:06:30.210
They have no idea.

143
00:06:30.210 --> 00:06:31.656
Because it's not clearly communicated.

144
00:06:31.656 --> 00:06:34.702
And when you don't clearly
communicate what your purpose is,

145
00:06:34.702 --> 00:06:37.930
it's impossible to create that
alignment within your team.

146
00:06:37.930 --> 00:06:42.470
It's impossible to get everybody
pulling in the same direction because

147
00:06:42.470 --> 00:06:44.780
everybody has no idea what
direction you're trying to go.

148
00:06:44.780 --> 00:06:48.830
Everybody has no idea what you're trying
to accomplish as an organization.

149
00:06:48.830 --> 00:06:52.410
And I think that's critical
to get clear alignment and

150
00:06:52.410 --> 00:06:56.950
focus in your team that everybody
can go in the same direction.

151
00:06:56.950 --> 00:07:00.450
And this is exactly what I'm talking
about when I say give my work meaning and

152
00:07:00.450 --> 00:07:01.340
value, right?

153
00:07:01.340 --> 00:07:05.100
They need to align their personal
purpose with your company's purpose,

154
00:07:05.100 --> 00:07:06.740
that is how you attract millennials.

155
00:07:06.740 --> 00:07:08.948
>> And I can even see this being
the case in a very large company.

156
00:07:08.948 --> 00:07:14.432
Maybe your division,
your department has a specific purpose,

157
00:07:14.432 --> 00:07:19.520
to help the other employees do things or
that kind of thing.

158
00:07:19.520 --> 00:07:22.920
If you're in an IT group or you're
in marketing or something like that.

159
00:07:22.920 --> 00:07:26.270
So it can be kind of maybe
on different levels as well.

160
00:07:26.270 --> 00:07:28.680
>> Right, yeah, definitely on
different levels it can exist.

161
00:07:28.680 --> 00:07:29.700
As the company grows,

162
00:07:29.700 --> 00:07:33.810
departments become their small little
organizations within corporations.

163
00:07:33.810 --> 00:07:35.560
And totally, that's gonna start aligning.

164
00:07:35.560 --> 00:07:37.752
I guarantee it's gonna be tied
to the main company purpose.

165
00:07:37.752 --> 00:07:42.780
But how we achieve, how we deliver on
that purpose is how things change.

166
00:07:42.780 --> 00:07:46.510
So I constantly encourage people,
you need to get clear on your purpose.

167
00:07:46.510 --> 00:07:48.800
You need to get clear on why you exist.

168
00:07:48.800 --> 00:07:52.498
And one of the other action items
which I think you can take.

169
00:07:52.498 --> 00:07:56.931
Is being extremely clear on your purpose
and putting it in every single job posting

170
00:07:56.931 --> 00:08:00.310
that you put out there for
a new employment.

171
00:08:00.310 --> 00:08:02.958
So many companies, you go through Monster,
you go through Craigslist.

172
00:08:02.958 --> 00:08:06.151
You go through Indeed or
any of these websites to look for jobs.

173
00:08:06.151 --> 00:08:09.217
And all the job postings
start with qualifications.

174
00:08:09.217 --> 00:08:12.335
Three years' experience in this,
two years' experience in this,

175
00:08:12.335 --> 00:08:13.583
must be able to do x, y, z.

176
00:08:13.583 --> 00:08:14.827
That's how they lead.

177
00:08:14.827 --> 00:08:18.078
In our company and the most
successful companies that I've seen.

178
00:08:18.078 --> 00:08:21.065
The very first thing on
the top of that job ad is,

179
00:08:21.065 --> 00:08:24.150
our purpose is to dot, dot, dot.

180
00:08:24.150 --> 00:08:25.712
And we clearly communicate that.

181
00:08:25.712 --> 00:08:29.148
>> And honestly, this is something that
even if you don't have any millennials on

182
00:08:29.148 --> 00:08:31.370
staff, you should probably
be doing this anyway.

183
00:08:31.370 --> 00:08:34.340
Because if you don't know why
you're doing what you're doing,

184
00:08:34.340 --> 00:08:36.516
you're probably not doing
it very well [LAUGH].

185
00:08:36.516 --> 00:08:37.511
Or not doing it as well as you can.

186
00:08:37.511 --> 00:08:40.829
So definitely something
important to have regardless.

187
00:08:40.829 --> 00:08:43.608
But any final thoughts on
this topic before we move on?

188
00:08:43.608 --> 00:08:48.181
>> Yes, I can't stress enough about
hiring based on this mindset, right?

189
00:08:48.181 --> 00:08:52.287
Really attracting the millennials and
non millennials by leading with your

190
00:08:52.287 --> 00:08:55.090
purpose in this job ad,
and this job posting.

191
00:08:55.090 --> 00:08:56.934
Because otherwise I
mean we've all done it.

192
00:08:56.934 --> 00:08:59.743
If anybody's here ever gone
through hiring and what not.

193
00:08:59.743 --> 00:09:04.338
You get so many people that are just
apply, apply, apply, apply, apply, apply,

194
00:09:04.338 --> 00:09:06.365
and you get all these applications.

195
00:09:06.365 --> 00:09:08.265
Most of it is garbage, right?

196
00:09:08.265 --> 00:09:11.014
But there's a few people,
when millennials start looking for work,

197
00:09:11.014 --> 00:09:12.702
when millennials start looking for a job.

198
00:09:12.702 --> 00:09:17.665
The very first thing they do is they
type in certain words in the keyword.

199
00:09:17.665 --> 00:09:21.420
And they pull up all the jobs that
kind of match those keywords.

200
00:09:21.420 --> 00:09:23.710
They read,
they'll probably get through about five or

201
00:09:23.710 --> 00:09:26.159
ten different postings that
kind of match their keywords.

202
00:09:26.159 --> 00:09:30.724
And they will apply, wholeheartedly
interested in why that company exists.

203
00:09:30.724 --> 00:09:33.878
If you can create that alignment and
you can create that kind of drive.

204
00:09:33.878 --> 00:09:37.410
You're gonna get a really motivated
millennial who's aligned with the reason

205
00:09:37.410 --> 00:09:38.579
why your company exists.

206
00:09:38.579 --> 00:09:41.024
And that's where you're gonna
get the quality millennial,

207
00:09:41.024 --> 00:09:42.206
the quality non millennial.

208
00:09:42.206 --> 00:09:46.184
Because somebody who believes what you
believe wants to be part of the mission

209
00:09:46.184 --> 00:09:47.490
that you're on.

210
00:09:47.490 --> 00:09:50.040
And that's where the key purpose is.

211
00:09:50.040 --> 00:09:54.330
That's where the key to really finding the
right team and aligning your company so

212
00:09:54.330 --> 00:09:56.490
that everybody's pulling
in the same direction.

213
00:09:56.490 --> 00:09:57.536
If you're not clear on that purpose.

214
00:09:57.536 --> 00:10:00.932
What you're gonna get is you're gonna
get an entire team of people pulling in

215
00:10:00.932 --> 00:10:01.985
opposite directions.

216
00:10:01.985 --> 00:10:05.170
And trying to accomplish God knows what
because they're not clear on what you

217
00:10:05.170 --> 00:10:06.315
wanna accomplish.

218
00:10:06.315 --> 00:10:10.375
>> Yeah, I think in the past people would
look at the classifieds or look online and

219
00:10:10.375 --> 00:10:12.365
say, okay, I'm looking for a sales job.

220
00:10:12.365 --> 00:10:14.315
So show me all the jobs
that have to do with sales.

221
00:10:14.315 --> 00:10:16.555
Now it seems like they're
more looking at the company.

222
00:10:16.555 --> 00:10:18.760
Show me the companies that I align with.

223
00:10:18.760 --> 00:10:21.933
And then let me find what they're hiring
for, and see if there's a fit there.

224
00:10:21.933 --> 00:10:26.510
Because it's more important about not what
you're doing, but who you're doing it for.

225
00:10:26.510 --> 00:10:27.318
>> That's right.
Yeah, and

226
00:10:27.318 --> 00:10:30.399
I think within a few seconds of
the millennial's reading your job ad.

227
00:10:30.399 --> 00:10:33.587
They will know if they wanna be
a part of your company or not.

228
00:10:33.587 --> 00:10:34.334
>> Right.

229
00:10:34.334 --> 00:10:35.250
>> And then they'll move on to the next.

230
00:10:35.250 --> 00:10:40.416
And I would probably last end with,
the best applicants that I've

231
00:10:40.416 --> 00:10:46.240
ever gotten typically come maybe
a week after the job has been posted.

232
00:10:46.240 --> 00:10:49.310
Why?
Because when a job post goes up first,,

233
00:10:49.310 --> 00:10:51.260
it kind of shows up new on the feed.

234
00:10:51.260 --> 00:10:54.500
So you get just random people that
are just applying to all kinds of jobs.

235
00:10:54.500 --> 00:10:58.950
About a week into it, your job post is no
longer the one on the top of the list.

236
00:10:58.950 --> 00:11:01.630
It's now hidden in the bunch,
and the only people who

237
00:11:01.630 --> 00:11:05.010
find it are the ones that are searching
key words that are listed in the job.

238
00:11:05.010 --> 00:11:07.650
And that is where you get
the people who are aligned.

239
00:11:07.650 --> 00:11:09.954
If you failed to describe your purpose.

240
00:11:09.954 --> 00:11:13.676
And a millennial or a non-millennial
searches for some of those key words.

241
00:11:13.676 --> 00:11:18.160
That align with their purpose, with what
they're trying to accomplish, guess what?

242
00:11:18.160 --> 00:11:19.040
They're never gonna find you.

243
00:11:19.040 --> 00:11:21.800
They're just gonna go through
qualifications just like any other

244
00:11:21.800 --> 00:11:23.470
company has.

245
00:11:23.470 --> 00:11:25.978
And you're never gonna get that top
quality candidate who believes what

246
00:11:25.978 --> 00:11:26.481
you believe.

247
00:11:26.481 --> 00:11:27.490
And that's the key.

248
00:11:27.490 --> 00:11:30.640
So millennials really want us as
entrepreneurs, as business owners,

249
00:11:30.640 --> 00:11:33.890
as business leaders,
to give their work meaning and value.

250
00:11:33.890 --> 00:11:37.910
>> Great points there, I know we've got
a lot more information to cover, and

251
00:11:37.910 --> 00:11:39.450
a lot more episodes to go here.

252
00:11:39.450 --> 00:11:41.760
So we're going to go ahead and
sign off for this episode.

253
00:11:41.760 --> 00:11:42.455
I'm Peter VanRysdam.

254
00:11:42.455 --> 00:11:44.686
>> And I'm Javier Montes,
your millennial expert.

255
00:11:44.686 --> 00:11:45.516
See you next time.

256
00:11:45.516 --> 00:11:46.675
>> Bye bye.

257
00:11:46.675 --> 00:11:56.675
[MUSIC]

WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.182 --> 00:00:05.671
[SOUND] Hello and welcome to the show.

2
00:00:05.671 --> 00:00:06.948
I'm your host Peter VanRysdam.

3
00:00:06.948 --> 00:00:11.236
And today we are continuing in our
discussion about what millennials want in

4
00:00:11.236 --> 00:00:12.180
the workplace.

5
00:00:12.180 --> 00:00:16.220
And specifically in this episode we're
talking about acknowledging our strengths

6
00:00:16.220 --> 00:00:16.800
and successes.

7
00:00:16.800 --> 00:00:18.310
I assume their strengths and successes.

8
00:00:18.310 --> 00:00:21.430
But here to help us understand
that topic we have Mr.

9
00:00:21.430 --> 00:00:24.250
Javier Montes who wrote
the book Millennial Workforce.

10
00:00:24.250 --> 00:00:25.130
Javier how are you doing?

11
00:00:25.130 --> 00:00:26.420
>> I'm doing fantastic Peter.

12
00:00:26.420 --> 00:00:27.720
As always, great to be here.

13
00:00:27.720 --> 00:00:28.658
Thank you for having me.

14
00:00:28.658 --> 00:00:33.350
And we're gonna dive right into this,
understanding the millennial mindset and

15
00:00:33.350 --> 00:00:34.480
what makes millennials tick.

16
00:00:34.480 --> 00:00:37.497
And today specifically, we're going
to talk about one of the things that

17
00:00:37.497 --> 00:00:39.730
millennials really want in the workplace.

18
00:00:39.730 --> 00:00:41.340
>> And what is that?

19
00:00:41.340 --> 00:00:46.340
>> So this one is going to be called
acknowledge my strengths and successes.

20
00:00:46.340 --> 00:00:47.770
So this is important, this is key.

21
00:00:47.770 --> 00:00:48.950
So let's dive right into it.

22
00:00:48.950 --> 00:00:50.020
Let's get started.

23
00:00:50.020 --> 00:00:52.860
Thank you for everybody tuning
in on Facebook Live right now.

24
00:00:52.860 --> 00:00:53.720
Make sure to say hi.

25
00:00:53.720 --> 00:00:58.140
Put your comments in the box below,
even if you're watching this afterwards.

26
00:00:58.140 --> 00:00:59.140
Put your comments below.

27
00:00:59.140 --> 00:01:03.660
I answer all the comments personally, so
I could definitely check you guys out.

28
00:01:03.660 --> 00:01:04.990
So definitely answer personally and

29
00:01:04.990 --> 00:01:07.980
we'll answer some of these
comments as we go along.

30
00:01:07.980 --> 00:01:08.780
But let's get right into it.

31
00:01:08.780 --> 00:01:11.010
Let's talk about acknowledge
my strengths and successes.

32
00:01:11.010 --> 00:01:13.070
And what does this mean?

33
00:01:13.070 --> 00:01:18.874
So millennials are very keen and
very, what's the word,

34
00:01:18.874 --> 00:01:23.737
very aware of what their strengths are,
right?

35
00:01:23.737 --> 00:01:26.296
So we all have strengths and
we all have weaknesses.

36
00:01:26.296 --> 00:01:30.370
And millennials, just like any other
generation know what their strengths are.

37
00:01:30.370 --> 00:01:31.327
They know what they are really good at.

38
00:01:31.327 --> 00:01:32.785
They know what they are best at.

39
00:01:32.785 --> 00:01:36.806
And they want these strengths
to be acknowledged, okay?

40
00:01:36.806 --> 00:01:38.636
That's the first thing.

41
00:01:38.636 --> 00:01:43.244
Compare that to previous generations,
and again to put this into context.

42
00:01:43.244 --> 00:01:46.393
Millennials want these strengths
to really be amplified and

43
00:01:46.393 --> 00:01:48.004
be used in our organizations.

44
00:01:48.004 --> 00:01:53.419
Now, previously to the modern day
big corporate America kind of had

45
00:01:53.419 --> 00:01:58.939
this mindset of, well, let's find
out what our team is not good at.

46
00:01:58.939 --> 00:02:01.591
Let's find out what the weaknesses
are amongst our team, and

47
00:02:01.591 --> 00:02:03.480
then they would bring in outside trainers.

48
00:02:03.480 --> 00:02:08.470
They'd bring in consultants to
help us improve the weaknesses.

49
00:02:08.470 --> 00:02:10.410
Millinneals don't believe in this concept.

50
00:02:11.510 --> 00:02:14.480
Millennials have very little interest

51
00:02:14.480 --> 00:02:18.440
in improving the things that they're
not good at, and this is key.

52
00:02:18.440 --> 00:02:23.860
Because millennials would rather spend
time either learning a new skill or

53
00:02:23.860 --> 00:02:26.860
improving on what their strengths are.

54
00:02:26.860 --> 00:02:29.710
And they don't really spend
a lot of time saying, well,

55
00:02:29.710 --> 00:02:31.670
look I know I'm not good at this.

56
00:02:31.670 --> 00:02:34.610
And I don't really care too much to
get a little better at it because

57
00:02:34.610 --> 00:02:36.410
I'm not really interested in doing that.

58
00:02:36.410 --> 00:02:38.210
So their weaknesses are there and
they don't really care so

59
00:02:38.210 --> 00:02:39.920
much to improve their weaknesses.

60
00:02:39.920 --> 00:02:44.580
So they want our companies to really find
what they're really, really good at and

61
00:02:44.580 --> 00:02:47.380
then capitalize on that
inside our organizations.

62
00:02:47.380 --> 00:02:50.520
So to put this into context, and
I'll give you a really good example.

63
00:02:50.520 --> 00:02:53.616
It's one of my favorite examples that
I think everybody can relate to.

64

Is let's talk about a football team,

And that makes everything else so
much easier and it just makes more sense.

304
00:12:41.710 --> 00:12:44.213
And if you find somebody that's
really good at something,

305
00:12:44.213 --> 00:12:46.474
don't be scared to move
them into another position.

306
00:12:46.474 --> 00:12:49.354
I mean that's how you find,
sometimes somebody doesn't know

307
00:12:49.354 --> 00:12:52.083
they're really good at something or
they love something.

308
00:12:52.083 --> 00:12:56.263
And that's how things get uncovered and
really come up to the forefront.

309
00:12:56.263 --> 00:12:57.745
And then let's capitalize on that.

310
00:12:57.745 --> 00:13:00.726
When somebody does something they really,
really enjoy doing,

311
00:13:00.726 --> 00:13:02.090
they're gonna do it so well.

312
00:13:02.090 --> 00:13:03.813
And it's gonna be natural to them, and

313
00:13:03.813 --> 00:13:07.382
you're gonna see exponential growth in
your organization in that department.

314
00:13:07.382 --> 00:13:10.372
>> Well, I know you're a millennial, so
I wanna say you're doing a great job,

315
00:13:10.372 --> 00:13:11.387
this is a fantastic show.

316
00:13:11.387 --> 00:13:13.015
>> [LAUGH]
>> [LAUGH] Another great episode full of

317
00:13:13.015 --> 00:13:14.270
lots of great information.

318
00:13:14.270 --> 00:13:17.070
We've got a lot more great information
coming your way as well, so

319
00:13:17.070 --> 00:13:18.021
be sure to stay tuned.

320
00:13:18.021 --> 00:13:19.969
But for
now signing off I am Peter VanRysdam.

321
00:13:19.969 --> 00:13:24.177
>> And I'm Javier Montes, your millennial
expert, we will see you next time,

322
00:13:24.177 --> 00:13:24.704
bye bye.
